intro: Peucedanum austriacum, commonly known as Austrian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its seeds are small and have a distinctive, aromatic scent, often used in traditional herbal remedies.
